Posts.Content: May 29, 2013 10:43AM Sparkytheimp wrote: I just got diagnosed as well. I see the surgeon today and hopefully they will be able to clear up some questions. This is a good site. Sad to see more people coming in by the day, but everyone is very supportive here and there are some funny stories that can help cheer you up. I just joined 3 days ago after it ocurred to me there might be a place like this. Good luck, one day at a time.
Posts.Title: Scared LanaM Sparkytheimp

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2013 11:38AM Sparkytheimp wrote: Thank you Maureen. I missed my appt last week because of no transportation. So I am still in limbo :( Hopefully this week I will get some answers.
Posts.Title: Scared LanaM Sparkytheimp

Posts.Content: May 27, 2013 02:56PM Sparkytheimp wrote: Annoyed. Yup. I'm there. This sucks big time. I was diagnosed 3 weeks ago, but because of my living situation I have had to move a lot in the last 3 months from when I first found that little bump that got my attention in the first place. I think I am emotionally retarded because it has taken so long to sink in with me. Not kidding one bit. I just passed annoyed an hour ago and went to sad. I am all over the place emotionally, however most of the time I try to just not think about it. I keep talking to myself saying things like it won't do any good to worry about it. I just have to get through it is all. I employ as many coping mechanisms as I can, usually the distracting kind. Which brought me here. I figure I should get with people who understand this sort of thing, and maybe I won't have to distract so much as be able to deal with it and share what I am fixing to go through with people who are like me.

Thank you for the speedy response. I am glad to have fond this site :)

Posts.Content: May 27, 2013 07:27PM Sparkytheimp wrote: Thank you again ladies. I will take my family member with me. He usually remembers things they say that slip past me. It just feels a little weird is all. He's a guy and not my partner or anything like that and it feels awful personal ya know?
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2013 08:46PM Sparkytheimp wrote: So yeah kids. I brought my family member with me to this one final vist before actual surgery. He was a wreck. All the way there he couldn't concentrate on anything, and yeah, he was a wreck. I felt like I was the one who had to hold him up. And then when he got in there, he didn't come up with any good questions I had not already asked. Damn, I was really hoping for better. I'm not sure about him wanting to care for me. I kind of don't think he can handle it. I don't expect to be out of commission for more than 2 weeks, maybe less. And yet from reading in here, I know that is not always the case. Now I am a bit lost :(
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: May 27, 2013 02:19PM Sparkytheimp wrote: You ladies are too kind :) Too many dang questions if you ask me. I am a very simple person and this whole thing seems a bit complex. I'm trying to rewire my thinking here all of a sudden and I am not really sure how healthy that is.
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: May 28, 2013 11:17AM Sparkytheimp wrote: A nurse navigator eh? See? I have been in here for 24 hours and already I am learning SO much! Those abbreviations, thanks for the link. I found it yesterday but of course, until I have something from the doc to actually work with, it is still prety much cryllic to me. My appointment is tomorrow so.....bleah. I just really want to get this over with and behind me. It's a pain and I am quite irritated with all the doctor visits and finding bus routes to go here or there and everywhere. Bleah. Maybe I will be less negative after tomorrow. Hey, on a good note though I may actually be able to enter my diagnosis data and stuff like ya'll have done :)
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2013 10:51AM Sparkytheimp wrote: Oh. My apologies. Suzanne had asked if I planned on reconstruction. I hadn't really planned on it, no. Of course, I keep reading and reavaluating my thoughts and feelings on this whole mess. Even though I am not that far yet, I explore this site and read quite a bit. I am still in a very confused state and probably not capable of making some of these decisions. Not yet. I am very glad to have landed here though. Sometimes I feel like no one is taking this seriously. Even I had a hard time really processing. I still try to be positive and not drag other people down when I am wanting to cry. I try to avoid my friends when I feel down like that. I am beginning to think maybe that is not a healthy thing to do though. I feel like such a burden to everyone :(
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2013 11:55AM Sparkytheimp wrote: Shirlann: I suppose there is a part of me that gets angry sometimes, but I am so mixed up emotionally I don't even realise when I do get angry. 15 years is so awesome. And yes, there are people that go from one end of the spectrum to the other. My friend was trying to council me on dying yesterday in an email. Really??? I never mentioned dying once to anyone. Then of course is the one who says oh, such and such had it and they were just fine, and another whos says her friend died from it and never felt a thing. How could she possibly know that? Anyway, I'm at the point now I just roll me eyes. hahahaha Suzzanne: In surgery right now, I hope it all goes good for you and as little pain as possible. It sounds like you did indeed find another calling in life and it makes you happy and for that I am very glad. I saw the surgeon. She says mastectomy definitely. I did enter my diagnosis but I don't see it now. My surgery is scheduled for the 21st. I really like my surgeon. She listens and she is very observant. She knows I am having mental problems and she wants to help with that after surgery. She did give me some meds that I need to sleep, and wow, I can't believe what a good night's sleep does for me. Somebody somewhere had mentioned how important it was to like your treatment team and so far, I really like them a lot.  And though I had no one with me this time, I actually remember the conversation well, and I did take some notes and what not, so all in all I feel good about this :)
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: May 27, 2013 03:39PM Sparkytheimp wrote: Whew. Well then I am not all that weird after all. Good oh. I finally told my friends on FB and then promptly started looking for funny pics to add to my post. I know, who does that right? haha Anyway, I have this horriblly insane sense of humour that keeps me quite distracted, even when I am thinking about it. Emotionally I think today is the first real day I have given this serious consideration, and that's how I fond this forum. I seem to be all over the place. I cry and think how dumb is that? It doesn't change anything. I may be a bit hard on myself too but I despise crying and especially in front of other people. Which is why I am currently hiding out in my room.

My appt got set back another week because of lack of transportation to see the surgeon. So, Wednesday, again. I have talked a family member into coming with me. He lives with me and I strongly feel he should be there so maybe he can get a grip on what I am going through. I'm not sure if dragging him with me for psychological help would be a good idea, but I can't help feeling he really has no idea how this is affecting me. I have my crying jags, and I hide when that happens. Any suggestions on that?
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2013 11:49AM Sparkytheimp wrote: Ah ha. I just found my voice recorder. Yay. You are correct about stupid comments. I ocurrs to me some people are either very insensitive, or just stupid. And horror of horrors, one person who is not exactly a friend said it was punishment and I must have made god angry. OMGs, seriously? How can anyone be that callous? This may be the reason why I find myself withdrawing from other people, or maybe I am just messed up in the head, not sure. Thanks for the hugs.
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2013 11:09AM - edited Jun 3, 2013 11:11AM by Sparkytheimp I don't know if I am just loopy, but these idiotic comments I am hearing from obviously deranged people are starting to tickle me a little. That's a good idea. Maybe I will start one for us newbies. Along with the most retarded things anyone has heard concerning "prevention" of this disease. WOW. Change of plan though. Now My family can't go with me after all, because the guy giving me a ride is picking up his worker and me at the same time as we will be going the same direction, and he has a really tiny truck. I have my voice recorder though, and thanks to this site and you great ladies, I am well armed with the right questions to ask. I may not understand everything they tell me, but that won't stop me from exhausting them with questions! I do have an awesome friend on the other side of the Country, literally, who has said she wants to fly out and be with me when I have surgery. She is such an awesome lady, and her sister had double mastectomy some years ago, so she knows this wole road. Plus she was a nurse in the mental health field, so she understands these crazy emotions that are all over the place. Oh, and she likes to be aggressive with the doctors  to get me good care. She has offered to speak to them for me, but I am almost afraid to let her. hahaha

Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2013 11:12AM Sparkytheimp wrote: Hello ladies. I am late getting here but I made it. Ha ha She did a skin sparing mastectomy on the one side, and took the sentinel and axillary nodes. I really need to say something here. Somebody at some point SHOULD have sat me down and explained to me that it would be a shock when I see it. I mean really? No kind of warning anywhere? ....meh.... It's okay though. I thought my surgeon was going to suck and not help me with pain, but she was awesome. She allowed me to stay doped up the entire time I was there, which was a surprisingly short time. I did contact ACS a while back. The best they can do is gas vouchers, which is at least enough to bribe someone. They did get me a nurse navigator, and she is pretty nice. Her hands are very full and in most cases just tied. I pretty much know the boundaries she can operate in, and that's fine. She is still a help :)
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2013 12:56PM Sparkytheimp wrote: I wish I knew how to find help. i am underinsured, live in the middle of nowhere and have no transportation. These comments do help. Thankfully my treatment team will be under one roof, but because of the transportation problem my appt with the surgeon has been put off for weeks. I also wish I knew how to not cry when asking for help. I want to be strong, but I get so frustrated. Someone mentioned in the forum that you find out who your friends are. I am starting to see that and it depresses me. Sorry ladies. Just had to spew for a second. I did join here just recently and this has helped quit a bit.
